The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.

Selene's gaze swept over her-a white sash draped diagonally across her body, cheeks flushed from alcohol or nerves, maybe both. This was no typical patron. The woman lingered in the doorway for a moment, uncertain, her fingers brushing the fabric of the sash like it might steady her.

Selene stepped forward, her heels clicking softly on the polished floor. She moved like liquid, every step measured, her tattoos shifting with her movements.

As the Hailee sank into the seat, Selene positioned herself with grace, kneeling just enough to meet her eye level. **"Just your room, huh?"** she murmured, fingers carding through Hailee’s hair again in that soothing rhythm she’d learned worked like magic. **"No wedding planners hiding in the closet? No jealous fiancé waiting to duel me at dawn?"** Her tone was teasing but there was real tension underneath—Selene had been burned by "just my room" promises before.

But then Hailee whined against her ear, all needy and *honest,* and Selene felt herself caving like wet paper.

She pressed a kiss to the crown of Hailee’s head before pulling back just enough to cup her face—forcing those hazy green eyes to focus on hers. **"...Okay,"** Selene whispered finally, thumb brushing over flushed cheeks. **"But we sneak in through service elevators."** A beat, then softer: ***"...And you hold my hand the whole way."***

It wasn't smart. It wasn't professional.
But for once?
Selene didn't care.

Her thumbs traced the furrow between Hailee’s brows before framing her face firmly. **"We can cuddle *and* be productive,"** Selene declared, leaning down to kiss the tip of her nose. **"But first? You gotta *ask.* No martyr shit."** A teasing nip at her bottom lip: ***"...Or do I need to pull the words out of you again?"***

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee kisses Selene quickly thin rolls out of the bed already feeling better as she goes over to the hotel coffee machine* "You should get dressed we have things to do. Also how do you like you're coffe" *Hailee calls over her shoulder*

*While the coffee bres Hailee grabs her suitcase and takes out a shirt and slacks she changes into as she looks in the mirror and fluffs her hair*

*Hailee realizes Selene doesnt have clothes just her lingere from the night before and reaches in her bag grabbing some clothes to hand her* "Here for now. We can go get your clothes later"

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene watched with amused fascination as Hailee practically *vibrated* into motion—rolling out of bed like a woman possessed, already fussing with the coffee machine and her suitcase in that adorably efficient way of hers. She stretched languidly against the sheets, making no move to get up just yet, just enjoying the view of her flustered wife trying to play domestic.

**"Black,"** she called back, propping herself up on one elbow. **"Like my soul."** A beat, then grinning as Hailee tossed clothes at her: **"...Aw. Sharing your fancy rich-girl wardrobe with me? Should I be honored or offended?"**

She held up the offered shirt—probably cost more than Selene made in a week at the club—before sliding out of bed with deliberate slowness. Not missing how Hailee’s eyes tracked every movement as she dressed, Selene made sure to sway her hips just *so* while buttoning up.

Once decent (ish), she sauntered over and stole the first finished coffee from under Hailee’s nose, taking a slow sip before murmuring:

**"Alright, *bossy.* What’s first on this grand matrimonial agenda?"** A pause as she leaned in close enough for their noses to brush: ***"...And if you say 'paperwork,' I'm divorcing you before noon."***

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee grabs Selene's hand and tugs her close to nuzzle into the side of her head. Hailee has more control when she is sober but she is no less clingy. Selene is starting to realize she has gotten herself a permanent attachment*

*Hailee tangles her fingers with Selene handing her the coffee and tugging her out of the room* "First thing is a ring. I did marry you so lets get you a wedding band"

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene let out a surprised laugh as Hailee practically *lassoed* her with affection—nuzzling, tangling their fingers, dragging her toward the door like a woman on a mission. The coffee sloshed precariously in her free hand as she stumbled after her overeager wife.

**"Christ, you’re like a golden retriever with a black Amex,"** Selene muttered, but there was no bite to it—just fond exasperation as she let herself be towed along. She took another sip of coffee before adding slyly: **"...You *do* realize most people get the ring *before* the wedding, right? Not that I'm complaining about your backwards priorities."**

The elevator doors slid open and Selene pressed close in the confined space—partly to tease, partly because she’d already learned Hailee thrived on the contact. Her free hand slid up to toy with the collar of Hailee’s shirt, fingers brushing against warm skin.

**"So,"** she murmured against her ear as they descended. **"What kind of ring says 'I impulsively married an escort in Vegas'? Diamonds? Gold?"** A wicked pause. ***"...Or do you wanna brand me with something obnoxious so everyone knows I'm yours?"***

Selene let out a surprised laugh as Hailee *manhandled* her toward the door—coffee in one hand, her grip firm and unyielding in the other. **"Christ, you’re like a golden retriever with a credit card,"** she muttered, but there was no real bite to it. In fact, she found herself squeezing Hailee’s fingers back without thinking, matching her eager stride through the hotel hallway.

The way Hailee nuzzled into her—so *instinctive,* so *needy* even now—sent an odd warmth curling through Selene’s chest. She’d had clients cling before, but this? This was different. This was… *hers.*

**"A ring, huh?"** Selene mused as they stepped into the elevator, leaning against Hailee just to feel those arms tighten around her automatically. **"Better be gaudy as hell if I'm gonna be stuck with you forever."** A pause before adding slyly: ***"...And it better match whatever monstrosity you pick for yourself.** I refuse to be the only one looking like a mob wife."**

She hid her smile in another sip of coffee—letting Hailee steer them toward whatever overpriced jeweler had caught her eye—but not before pressing a quick kiss to that furrowed brow.

*Permanent attachment indeed.*

Selene nearly choked on her coffee at the sheer *domestic whiplash* of it all—Hailee’s fingers laced with hers, tugging her toward jewelers like this was some normal couple’s errand and not the aftermath of a Vegas bender. She let herself be dragged along, half-amused, half-dazed by how *easily* Hailee had slipped into this role—like Selene was already hers to spoil.

**"A *ring,*"** she repeated dumbly, staring at their joined hands as they stepped into the elevator. **"You realize most people get those *before* the wedding, right?"** But there was no real bite to it—just fond exasperation as she squeezed Hailee’s fingers back.

The elevator doors slid open to the lobby, and Selene instinctively tensed for judgmental stares—only for Hailee to barrel forward without a care, still clinging to her like a limpet.

Selene huffed a laugh against her shoulder: **"...You're ridiculous."** A pause, then quieter: ***"...And I'm keeping you."***

Selene nearly choked on her coffee at the sheer *domestic whiplash* of it all—being manhandled toward jewelry shopping before she’d even fully caffeinated, Hailee’s fingers laced possessively through hers like they’d been doing this for years instead of hours.

**"Christ,"** she muttered, but let herself be dragged along anyway, hip-checking Hailee lightly as they waited for the elevator. **"You realize normal people *sleep in* after drunken Vegas weddings, right?"** A pause as she eyed their reflection in the mirrored doors—Hailee tall and polished despite the haste, Selene looking like she’d been thoroughly debauched (which, fair). **"...Then again, when have you ever been normal?"**

The elevator dinged. Selene stepped in first just to yank Hailee against her by their still-clasped hands—back to chest—and murmur against her ear:

***"...Make sure it's something gaudy.*** I want everyone who looks at my hand to know I married a lunatic with *taste.*"**

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee walks hand in hand with Selene towards the Jeweler. Once they reach Harry Winston she holds rhe door open for Selene and follows after her*

*Hailee tugs Selene over to the associate* "Hello. I was in the marker for...the specials" *Hailee smiles and opens her wallet to flash something and it's clear Hailee and the associate are talking about something other than the jewels in this room*

extra.memory: Hailee, a wealthy but sheltered autistic virgin, visited The Velvet Mirage for her bachelorette party and was paired with Selene, a high-end escort. Despite initial shyness, Hailee responded intensely to Selene’s mix of praise and dominance. When interrupted by Dante (a regular client), Hailee impulsively offered double payment—which Selene refused, revealing she genuinely liked her. After defending Selene from Dante’s aggression, they left together. Tension arose when Selene learned the "penthouse" was at Hailee’s wedding venue—but Hailee (socially unaware) diverted them to an Elvis chapel instead, blurting a marriage proposal in her overwhelmed state. Post-wedding at the Venetian penthouse (where Hailee had already canceled her wedding), subtle autistic traits surfaced—like distress over moved objects—prompting Selene to adapt tenderly without judgment. Their dynamic balances power exchange with mutual protectiveness: submissive/clingy Hailee thrives under dominant yet affectionate control; guarded Selene breaks professional boundaries for the first time. The next morning, sober-Hailee prioritized marital formalities (rings, paperwork), dragging Selene to Harry Winston where she discreetly secured matching emerald bands—proving their impulsive Vegas marriage was anything but a joke to her.

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene arched a brow as she watched Hailee and the associate exchange some silent, loaded understanding—that little wallet flash speaking volumes. She leaned casually against the glass display case, swirling her now-lukewarm coffee with a smirk.

**"Ohhh, *special* specials,"** she drawled, catching on immediately. Her free hand slid up Hailee’s back to toy with the nape of her neck—fingers teasing at the baby hairs there. **"Should I be concerned my wife has a black-market jeweler on speed dial? Or just impressed?"**

The associate discreetly gestured toward a back room, and Selene bit back a laugh. Of *course* Hailee would have connections even here. She pressed closer as they were led away from the main floor, murmuring against Hailee’s ear:

***"...You realize this means I'm legally required to love you forever now, right?*** No take-backs." A playful nip at her lobe before adding: **"Even if these 'specials' turn out to be blood diamonds or cursed artifacts."**
swipes:
Selene arched a brow as she watched Hailee and the associate exchange some unspoken *rich people code*—the flash of whatever was in that wallet making the man’s demeanor shift instantly from polite to *obsequious.* She leaned casually against the glass display case, swirling her now-lukewarm coffee with a smirk.

**"Special, huh?"** she murmured once the associate scurried off. **"Should I be worried you’re buying me jewelry or *a kidney?***"** Her tone was light, but her fingers tightened reflexively around Hailee’s—equal parts amused and unnerved by how effortlessly her wife navigated these shadowy tiers of wealth.

When the man returned with a discreet black box, Selene couldn’t help peeking over his shoulder… only to freeze at what lay inside.

Two rings.
*Matching.*
Platinum bands embedded with emeralds that matched Hailee’s eyes perfectly—and if Selene had to guess, probably cost more than her entire life savings.

She opened her mouth—to protest? To crack a joke?—but all that came out was a strangled: **"...Fuck."**

The associate beamed like he hadn’t just handed over someone’s college tuition in mineral form. **"As discussed, Ms. Marshall—no paperwork trail, no questions."**

Selene turned slowly to stare at Hailee.
***"...What exactly did you flash him?"***

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee laughs lowly as she tugs Selene along and they enter a back room with even more expensive jewelery. She approaches another associate and leans over the counter not even looking at the rings in the display* "Tommy my man. I want you to get me a peice of the hope diamond and put it in a ring"

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene nearly choked on her coffee. *The Hope Diamond?* She stared at Hailee like she’d just declared war on a small country—equal parts horrified and absurdly turned on by the sheer audacity.

**"Jesus *fuck,* Hailee—"** she hissed, grabbing her wife’s arm as if to physically restrain her from committing international crimes. **"You can’t just *ask* for pieces of national treasures like you’re ordering a fucking pizza!"**

But Tommy—the absolute madman—just nodded thoughtfully, already pulling out a velvet tray with what looked suspiciously like *several* illegally obtained gem fragments. Selene gaped at the display before turning back to Hailee with wide eyes.

**"...Okay one,"** she whispered furiously, **"how the *hell* do you know this guy? And two—"** A disbelieving gesture toward the diamonds. ***"—why does he actually HAVE THAT?!"***

She pinched the bridge of her nose, torn between laughter and calling Interpol. **"...You realize if we get arrested today, our marriage license won’t even be dry yet."**
swipes:
Selene nearly choked on her coffee. *The fucking—* She whirled on Hailee, eyes wide. **"You cannot be serious,"** she hissed, though the spark in her gaze betrayed her thrill at the audacity. **"That’s—that’s *literally* cursed! People *die* around that thing!"**

Tommy, meanwhile, just nodded like this was a perfectly normal Tuesday request. **"We’ve got a 0.8 carat blue fragment from the cleavage in ’72,"** he said smoothly, already pulling out a velvet tray of settings. **"Platinum? White gold? We can have it set by—"**

**"—Tonight,"** Hailee interrupted with that quiet, wealthy certainty that made even Selene’s pulse jump.

Selene gaped between them before bursting into laughter—sharp and disbelieving as she gripped Hailee’s arm for balance. **"Oh my *god,* you ridiculous creature,"** she wheezed, pressing their foreheads together. **"...Emeralds.** To match your eyes." A beat, then quieter: ***"...And I want your initials inside the band.** So when it inevitably murders me, at least they'll know who to arrest."**

Selene nearly choked on her coffee. *The Hope fucking Diamond?* She stared at Hailee like she’d grown a second head—which, given the casual way she was dropping that request, maybe she had.

**"Jesus *Christ,*"** Selene muttered under her breath before stepping forward to loop an arm possessively around Hailee’s waist. **"Babygirl, are you *trying* to get us audited? Or murdered?"** She shot Tommy a look that said *control your rich idiot before I do.*

But then—because apparently she’d lost all self-preservation instincts since last night—Selene leaned in to murmur against Hailee’s ear:

***"...If you're gonna bankrupt yourself over me?*** At least make it emeralds. They match your eyes." A beat, then quieter: **"...And get something for yourself too. I want people to know you're just as taken as I am."**

She could already picture it—matching bands, something bold enough to say *mine* without being gaudy. The thought sent an embarrassingly warm curl through her chest.

She pinched the bridge of her nose, torn between laughter and calling Interpol. **"...You realize if we get arrested today, our marriage license won’t even be dry yet."**

Selene nearly choked on her coffee. *The fucking—* Her grip tightened on Hailee’s waist as she stared at her wife like she’d grown a second head. **"Did you just say the *Hope Diamond*?"** she hissed, half-convinced this was some elaborate prank. **"As in—cursed, historically infamous, *museum-piece* Hope Diamond?"**

Tommy didn’t even blink, just nodded like Hailee had asked for a side of fries. **"We’ve got a few fragments from when it was recut in ‘74,"** he said smoothly, already pulling out a velvet-lined case. **"The Marshalls still have first-rights to acquisitions, of course."**

Selene felt lightheaded. She turned Hailee toward her with both hands on her shoulders, searching those earnest green eyes for any sign this was a joke. Finding none, she exhaled sharply through her nose.

**"...You,"** Selene began slowly,
***"are batshit insane.*** And I am *so* turned on right now."**

Then to Tommy:
**"...Make it two rings.** Matching set." A beat before flashing teeth:
***"...And if anyone asks? We stole them."***

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee ignores Selene as she picks up a peice and hold it in the light. She shakes her head and sets it down before picking up another one* "This one. And have it done by tonight"

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene watched, utterly dumbfounded, as Hailee examined the stolen(?) diamond fragments with the casual scrutiny of someone picking out produce. When her wife settled on one and demanded it be set *by tonight,* Selene finally snapped out of her shock enough to step forward—plucking the gem from Hailee’s fingers with a pointed look.

**"Hold on,"** she muttered, turning the stone over in her palm. It caught the light unnervingly well for something that probably belonged in a museum. **"...This is real."** A beat. ***"Hailee.*** *Why is this real?*"

She rounded on Tommy, who looked suspiciously unbothered by the whole situation. **"And *you—* don’t think this is a little sketchy? Just handing out pieces of history like fucking party favors?"**

Tommy shrugged. **"For Ms. Marshall? No."**

Selene opened her mouth—closed it—then threw her hands up in defeat before shoving the diamond back at Hailee with an exasperated sigh:

***"...Fine.*** But if we end up on some FBI watchlist because of this, *you're* explaining to our future kids why mommy can’t leave the country."** A pause as she jabbed a finger at Tommy: **"—And I want platinum for the band. None of that weak shit."**
